body: @kezhenxu94 Thank you, I see.

Now the alarm rule has been effected, but it does not send the alarm message. I want to read the log info to sort out problems, but I do not see any alarm log.

Should be time based desc order. Which storage are you using?

Are you interested to send a pull request to fix? This is an easy fix

Using the ElasticSearch 6.5.4 as storage.
Sorry that I couldn't send a fix for you asI don't know the exact cause for this problem.

Maybe I should upgrade to the latest Skywalking 6.3.0 and try again.
I can't tell why as you said others are well. I think you have to locate why by yourself. first. My guess, your storage, maybe es, is not working well.
No plan yet. We are not chasing the latest version. It is not very friendly to change this in high frequency.

> Why put http here? Are you trying to support https?

yes

Put an optional config in es storage provider. This change breaks existing user config, but get little benifit.

Add a config named protocol, use http as default value.

/run e2e
Could you test 6.3.0 first? There is a bug in 6.2.0-, fixed by @kezhenxu94

@candyleer 

I did following changes

1. Adopt the latest bytebudy changes(snapshot only), commit https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/commit/b60971156403ed8fba6124b8e424f0749917594a. 
2. Remove disruptor by ArrayBlockingQueue, because Disruptor can't work in both JDK 8(1) and 9-12, if we don't add `--add-modules jdk.unsupported`
3. Doc update. Remove following
~~Since Java 9, JDK introduced a new level of abstraction above packages, formally known as the Java Platform Module System (JPMS), or “Modules” for short.
When you are using this JDK feature, add `--add-modules jdk.unsupported` to the JVM argument, 
if your application hasn't require `jdk.unsupported`, such as log output showing `Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: sun.misc.Unsafe`.~~
/run ci
/run e2e
I just active CI again, because bytebuddy just did a release 1.10.1
/run e2e
ok, thanks:)
/run ci
/run e2e
` Collector traceSegment service doesn't response ` also means, server-side is not active.

@candyleer Please test and review. 

@apache/skywalking-committers This is ready to merge.

Why we do this? Targeting real driver is much better. You do not require application level change, unless necessary. 

I could share with you, tracing any jdbc is not working. We havr tried, but fail. Because there are many jdbc object type casts in real world. Delegation breaks the type cast

It's work for me on oracle database
And I found there no plugin for oracle jdbc
We have oracle plugin list in doc. It is not an Apache plugin, because of license. Many oracle cases don't fit, we have faced before.
Duplicate of #2659 , hope you can provide a demo project to help us reproduce the issue

I close web ui，it maybe calculate p99、p95 ....

If stop twice, that is a bug. This fix is not right. You need to figure out whether
1. Should create two noop span

Or
2. Should stop span once.
`StackBasedTracingSpan` is only for performance consideration when tracing is active.
You agents are required to reboot, if its version lower than 6.2.0(included)

I did not find the problem in the case of 20 concurrent threads, so I did not use the AsyncSpan API.
Did not find the cause of the problem, @monkeyAlwaysWin monkeyAlwaysWin is there no problem to delete the gateway plugin?
/run e2e
What do you mean sample == 0? What is the point? Tracing based on root sample is default and always in this way, you don't need to set.
Why could not find http servlet, it should be in classpath
Not sure what is happening. The class w/ annotation is there.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/62945488-646b8400-be11-11e9-9067-3567573ad3a0.png)

Assume in this scene，the service dependency: A -> B -> C. When A not sampling, the B should not sampling too. But now sampling == 0 in A will not be propagated to B, so we will get an incomplete trace without A.

No, in SkyWalking that is not right. If service A sampled, then service B should always be sampled, but if A is not, then B even doesn't know A existing, it chooses based on its own sampling mechanism.

SkyWalking not sampled means agent running in mini payload, no actual data. We don't support the case you are saying.

In SkyWalking 100% sampling is recommended.
/run ci
Feedback, this is caused by JDK 11. We don't support that.
/run e2e
Do you consider supporting the case in the future?

> Do you consider supporting the case in the future?

I don't think so, that is not fitting APM requirement. Most cases, we need whole traces to get accurate metrics.

Originally everything is normal.When I have a problem the disk space is full, I emptied the es data and restarted it.Now The agent has the above problem.
commit
what is the process？
@candyleer Any update?
If you erased all es data, you need to reboot agents.
No update. No one submit any pull request related to this. I think you should ask brpc team to help, rather than here. @wenweihu86 We don't know who are using brpc-java.
What is your problem? TTL of ES is day related.
Oh my god!!!

storage:
   elasticsearch:
       recordDataTTL: 45

trace data was deleted once every two days.

2019-08-13 00:02:03,809 - org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.library.client.elasticsearch.ElasticSearchClient - 161 [pool-17-thread-1] DEBUG [] - delete skywalking_segment-20190811 index finished, isAcknowledged: true
OK. Get your point. Are you saying the TTL of the record is using TTL of day metrics, right?
I did the same thing in another environment, but the agent can send data normally without restarting.I do not know this is why?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11767168/62993004-3f662800-be88-11e9-8a85-bc4114e8f7ea.png)
Agent did not restart.
yes
Hard to tell from my side. If you erased the metadata, reboot is required, unless in 6.3.0+ agent.
ES and other storages have this same issue. Reporting bug to @peng-yongsheng
ok, thank you!!!
I don't know either. You need to check the grpc and network by yourself.

> Why could not find http servlet, it should be in classpath

http servlet in tomcat-embed-core-8.5.31.jar  but spring cloud gateway use netty server,the spring cloud gateway project can be running without HttpServlet
I think plugin required, right? @zhaoyuguang
I don't know what you did. Do you upgrade from old version or something?

yes,i use the image in docker hub ,and run is ,and in version 6.1.0 ,there is no exception in it ,when i used the 6.3.0. it faild and the run commod is like this.
sudo docker run -e TZ="Asia/Shanghai"  --name apche-oap-node1 --restart always -d -p 12800:12800 -p 11800:11800 -e SW_STORAGE=elasticsearch -e SW_STORAGE_ES_CLUSTER_NODES=ip:port,ip:port,ip:port -e SW_NAMESPACE=skywalking -e SW_STORAGE_ES_BULK_ACTIONS=2000 -e SW_STORAGE_ES_BULK_SIZE=20 -e SW_STORAGE_ES_FLUSH_INTERVAL=10 -e SW_STORAGE_ES_CONCURRENT_REQUESTS=2 -e SW_STORAGE_ES_QUERY_MAX_SIZE=5000 -e SW_STORAGE_ES_QUERY_SEGMENT_SIZE=200 -e SW_CLUSTER=nacos -e SW_SERVICE_NAME=SkyWalking_OAP_Cluster -e SW_CLUSTER_NACOS_HOST_PORT=ip:port,ip:port,ip:port apache/skywalking-oap-server

In this kind of upgrade, unless you have followed our changes(known our storage changes), you need to
1. Stop all agents.
1. Stop OAPs, and erase ES all indexes.
1. Clear the OAP buffers
1. Reboot everything back online.
i just try the 6.2.0 version ,it doesn't has the exception .did you have change the storage format at 6.3.0?
In 6.2.0, it changed too. Read the changes log in the root folder. No exception doesn't mean it works as expected.
thank you for your answer
Thanks.

First, upgrade version to 6.3.0, we noticed dirty read in prev release when ElasticSearch is not powerful enough. Then, make your your ElasticSearch bulk settings are right, otherwise, you will lose the update randomly.
English only. Sorry.
Which exception? Do you miss it?

2019-08-14T09:44:28.692206051Z 2019-08-14 17:44:28,692 - org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.receiver.jvm.provider.handler.JVMSourceDispatcher -51103 [grpc-default-executor-0] WARN  [] - Can't found service by service instance id from cache, service instance id is: 55
2019-08-14T09:44:28.945138635Z 2019-08-14 17:44:28,944 - org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.receiver.jvm.provider.handler.JVMSourceDispatcher -51355 [grpc-default-executor-0] WARN  [] - Can't found service by service instance id from cache, service instance id is: 56
the WARNINGlike this
This means you do upgrade in OAP backend, but don't reboot all agents.
